gurmukhi: Aiq AMg surMg snwh suBM ] bhu kSt srUp su kSt CuBM ] Aiq bIr ADIr n BXo kb hI ] idv dyv pCwnq hYN sb hI ]225]
transliteration: At(i) An Suran Sanaah Soubhan|| Bahu Kasht Saroop Su Kasht Chhoubhan|| At(i) Beer Adheer Na Bhyo Kab Hee|| Div Dev Pachhaadat Hain Sab Hee||225||
translation: His limbs are of extremely pretty colour and he had the power to agonise hardest tribulations; this warrior has never become impatient and all the gods and goddesses recognize him quite nicely.225.

gurmukhi: Bt krm ibkrm jbY Dir hY ] rx rMg qurMgih ibcir hY ] qb bIr suDIrih ko Dir hY ] bil ibkRm qyj qbY hir hY ]226]
transliteration: Bhat Karam Bikram Jabai Dhar(i) Hai|| Ran Ran Turanad(i) Bichar(i) Hai|| Tab Beer Sudheerah(i) Ko Dhar(i) Hai|| Bal(i) Bikram Tej Tabai Har(i) Hai||226||
translation: When all these warriors will assume their power, then they will ride their horses and wander; who is your fighter, who will be able to keep patience in front of them? These powerful ones will abduct the glory of all.226.

gurmukhi: ieh ibiD qn sUrw suDr DY hY niRp Aibbyk ] niRp ibbyk kI idis suBt TwF n rih hY eyk ]227]
transliteration: Eh Bidh(i) Tan Sooraa Sudhar Dhai Hai Nrip Abibek|| Nrip Bibek Kidis(i) Suhat Thaadh Na Rah(i) Hai Ek||227||
translation: O king ! in this way, Avivek will assume the bodies of various warriors and no warrior of Vivek will stay in front of him.227.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtky gRMQy pwrs miCMdR sMbwdy niRp Aibbyk Awgmn nwm suBt brnn nwm iDAwie smwpqm suBm squ ] APjU ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatke Granthe Paaras Machhindra Sanbade Nrip Abibek Aagman Naam Soubhat Barnan Naam Dhiaae Samaaptam Soubham Sat(u)|| Aphijoo||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Dialogue of parasnath and Matsyendera, arrival of the king Avivek and the description of his warriors’ in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: AQ niRp ibbyk ky dl kQnM ]
transliteration: Ath Nrip Bibek Ked Al Kathanan||
translation: Now begins the description of the army of king Vivek

gurmukhi: ijh pRkwr Aibbyk niRpiq dl sihq bKwny ] nwm Twm AwBrn su rQ sB ky hm jwny ]
transliteration: Jih Prakaar Abibek Nripat(i) Dal Sahit Bakhaane|| Naam Thaam Aabharn Su Rath Sabh Ke Ham Jaane||
translation: The way in which the army of the king Avivek has been described; we have known all his warriors with their name, place, garment, chariot etc.,

gurmukhi: SsqR AsqR Aru DnuK Dujw ijh brx aucwrI ] qÍpRswid mundyv skl su ibbyk ibcwrI ]
transliteration: Shastra Astra Ar(u) Dhanoukh Dhujaa Jih Baran Ouchdaree|| Tva-prasaadh Mounndev Sakal Su Bichdaree||
translation: The way in which their arms, weapons, bows and banners have been described, in the same way, O great sage ! kindly describe your views about Vivek,

gurmukhi: kir kiRpw skl ijh ibiD khy iqh ibiD vhY bKwnIAY ] ikh Cib pRBwv ikh duiq niRpiq niRp ibbyk AnumwnIAY ]1]228]
transliteration: Kar(i) Kridaa Sakal Jih Bidh(i) Kahe Tih Bidh(i) Vahai Bakhaaneeai|| Kih Chhab(i) Prabhaav Kih Dout(i) Nripat(i) Nrip Bibek Anoumaaneeai||1||228||
translation: And present a complete narration about him; O great sage ! give your assessment about the beauty and impact of Vivek.1.228.

gurmukhi: AiDk nXws mun kIn mMqR bhu BwNq aucwry ] qMqR BlI ibiD sDy jMqR bhu ibiD iliK fwry ]
transliteration: Adhik Nyaas Mounndkeen Mantra Bahu Bhaant Ouchdare|| Tantra Bhalibidh(i) Sadhe Jantra Bahu Bidh(i) Likh(i) Ddare||
translation: The sage made a great effort and recited many mantras; he performed practices of several kinds of Tantras and Yantras;

gurmukhi: Aiq pivqR huAY Awp bhur au`cwr kro iqh ] niRp ibbyk Aibbyk sihq sYnw kiQXo ijh ]
transliteration: At(i) Pavitra Huai Aap Bahur Ouchchaar Daro Tih|| Nrip Bibek Abibek Sahit Sainaa Kathio Jih||
translation: Becoming extremely pure, he spoke again and the way in which he had described Avivek alongwith his army, he also narrated in the same way about the king Vivek;

gurmukhi: sur Asur ckiRq chu ids Bey Anl pvn sis sUr sB ] ikh ibiD pRkwS kir hY sMGwr jky j`C gMDrb sB ]2]229]
transliteration: Sur Asur Chkrit Chahu Dis Bhae Anal Pawan Sas(i) Soor Sabh|| Kih Bidh(i) Prakaadh Kar(i) Hai Sanhaar Jake Jachchh Gaddhrab Sabh||2||229||
translation: The Gods, Demons, Agni, Wind, Surya and Chandra, all were wonder-struck; even Yakshas and Gandharvas were also immersed in astonishment thinking how the light of Vivek will destroy the darkness of Avivek.2.229.
